str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To give evidence (bear witness) against. From kata and martureo; to testify against.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
